intro: Seriphidium korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Seriphidium korovinii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is part of the broader genus Seriphidium, which includes several species with similar ecological traits.
